concept.title: Troubleshoot from the Alarm Panel

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Provides detailed steps for troubleshooting system-level UPS faults, including diagnostics, alarm evaluation, corrective actions, and verification after repair.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: event logs; system controller; inverter; rectifier; sensors; alarm panel; power modules

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: system troubleshooting,UPS diagnostics,alarms,fault isolation,error codes,corrective actions

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: Help operators and technicians identify, analyze, and correct system-wide UPS faults

fig.note: The alarm text is displayed in English
The alarm text is only displayed in English even if another system language is used.

entry.ph: The input voltage (average) is out of tolerance
The input frequency is out of tolerance
At least one phase is not connected
Wiring at the rectifier mains input terminal

sli.ph: and “Rectifier mains fault” is not active
The DC is below the low DC warning/shutdown level
The DC power input is out of tolerance or unavailable.
The DC is above the high DC warning/shutdown level
The fuse trip indicator is not connected
Inverter supplied by the battery in the external DC UPS system

entry.ph: The DC is below the low DC warning level
The DC is below the low DC warning level
Switch open or auxiliary contact not connected
One of the battery poles is connected to earth
The inverter power unit temperature is too high
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system

sli.ph: Inverter input switch Q020 is open
The bypass mains frequency is out of tolerance or unstable

entry.ph: The bypass mains voltage or the frequency is out of tolerance
Wiring at the bypass mains input terminal
Manual bypass switch Q050 is not at position Auto
The bypass mains voltage or the frequency is out of tolerance
The static switch EN temperature is too high

sli.ph: The static switch EA temperature is too high
111-114: Static switches temperature warning or shutdown
116-139: Power module temperature warning or shutdown
The winding material is too hot
The heat-sink of the power components is too hot
6: PSU AC or DC not working
7: AC power supply for parallel inverter fault
8: DC power supply for parallel inverter fault
Power supply units : PSU A201 / A202
AC or DC power supply sources

entry.ph: 96: At least one parallel cable interrupted
At least one of the parallel cables are inoperable or disconnected
At least one phase is not connected
Wiring at the rectifier mains input terminal
The input frequency is out of tolerance
The input voltage is out of tolerance

sli.ph: and “Rectifier mains fault” is not active
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
The Input voltage is low but in tolerance
The system is turned off or in standby
The rectifier or PSU is inoperable
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
The system is turned off or in standby
The rectifier or PSU is inoperable
The battery is discharged or disconnected during battery operation
The fuse trip indicator is not connected
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
The output voltage is calibrated incorrectly
One or more battery cells are defective
The system is turned off or in standby

entry.ph: The battery monitor not reset after installation of new battery
Battery breaker open or auxiliary contact not connected
One of the battery poles is connected to earth

sli.ph: Connector cable is missing to at least one of the PSUs
The rectifier mains is not available or the rectifier mains input breaker is open
The battery is disconnected or a battery breaker is open

entry.ph: Overtemperature on the rectifier power components
The ambient temperature is too high
The sensor contacts are not connected

sli.ph: One or more fans are blocked, rotating too slow or disconnected

conbody.p: There are multiple LED’s on the display that can be used for optional alarms. Here are information on how to troubleshoot some of the standard options:
conbody.note: Not all alarms are possible for all system configurations.

entry.ph: Rectifier output switch Q003 open [5 seconds]

The rectifier output switch Q003 is open. The battery and the load are disconnected from the rectifier. The load can only be supplied by the bypass mains or from the battery. The rectifier is turned off.
Inverter input switch Q020 open [5 seconds]

The inverter input switch Q020 has automatically or manually been opened. The inverter is disconnected from the rectifier and battery. The load can only be supplied by the bypass mains. The alarm Inv. fuse blown will be activated.

The inverter input switch Q020 has automatically or manually been opened. The inverter is disconnected from the DC input power. The load can only be supplied by the bypass mains. The alarm Inv. fuse blown will be activated.
Inverter output switch Q030 open[5 seconds]
The inverter output switch Q030 is open. The load can only be supplied via the static switch EN or from the bypass mains via the manual bypass switch Q050 at position Bypass.

sli.ph: The load output switch Q100 is open.
The system output is disconnected from the inverter.
The load is no longer supplied.
One or more of the outgoing feeders in the AC distribution has tripped.
Overload or short-circuit on one of the outgoing feeders.
One or more of the outgoing feeders in the AC distribution are open.
Overload or short-circuit on one of the outgoing feeders.
Earth fault on the AC output.
The insulation resistance to earth is below set point.
Q003 is open or auxiliary contact is not connected
Q003 auxiliary contact is not connected to its input on the interface
Q003 auxiliary contact is only connected to an option input

entry.ph: Distribution input switch Q100 is open or auxiliary contact is not connected
DC voltage output from the rectifier is too high

sli.ph: The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
The system is turned off or in standby
The rectifier or PSU is inoperable
The battery is disconnected or a battery breaker is open

entry.ph: Dropper voltage out of tolerance[5 seconds]
The dropper voltage is outside the tolerance window

sli.ph: The dropper fans are inoperable or too slow.
Supply to the fans are missing
One or more of the outgoing feeders in the DC distribution has tripped
Overload or short-circuit on one of the outgoing feeders
One or more of the outgoing feeders in the DC distribution are open
Overload or short-circuit on one of the outgoing feeders

entry.ph: Earth fault on the DC output in the distribution
